_header: When it cometh in my thought the mickle sorrow and sin
_description: Old Testament History, from the Creation through the Prophets, in the Temporale of the South English Legendary — 1806 lines in long-line couplets

BodLauMis622.First Lines:
ffor þritty pens þai solden þat childe þe seller
                    hiȝth Iudasþo Ruben com hom & myssed hym sori ynouȝ he
                    was…
BodLauMis622.Last Lines:
…Atte last schal come þe holi gost in forme of swerd
                    alȝt& Anticrist to deþ smyte þorouȝ his swete
                    miȝt
BodLauMis622.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Adam Davy’s 5 Dreams about Edward II, etc. from Bodleian Laud
                Misc. 622.
EETS
         o.s. 69 (1878; repr. 1973): 82-90, 96-8 (extract, 318 lines).

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
[Whan] hit comeþ in my þouht þe muchele sor and
                    sunne…[ ]þe sorinesse and wrecchedhede þat seweþ heer
                    monkunne
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Sone hedde þe Lyouns forswolewed heom euerichonAnd so ur
                    lord euere among nymeþ wreche of his foon
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodAddC220.First Lines:
Wan hit comeþ in my þout þe muche sore &
                    syneþe sorwenesse & þe wrecchede þat seweþ here man
                    kyneGlade ne blyþe may y be & wonder his hit nouhtMore wonder
                    hit his how Ioye may come in oure þouht…
BodAddC220.Last Lines:
…In sorwe þou schalt þy lyf lede with wo on erþe
                    be& in grete peyne þou schalt childe bere & alle þat
                    comen of þe
BodAddC220.Note:
262 lines (through the Life of Noah only). Fragment on 31-32v
                    ends imperfectly due to the loss of folios with, ‘& in grete peyne
                    þu schalt childe bere & alle þat comen of þe’; fragment
                    on 1-2v starts with, ‘Anay sede oure lorde þo ne dar
                    þe noþyng drede / Ne schal no man quelle þe for þe foule
                    dede’ and ends with, ‘For he sende hem diuerse langege þat non
                    knew oþeres speche / & fouhten as þey wode were þat was here
                    wreche’.

CamStJohn28.First Lines:
Whan it comyþ in my þouȝt þe meche sorwe and
                    synneþe sorynesse & þe wrecchidhede þat folwith al man
                    kynne…
CamStJohn28.Last Lines:
…Wol sone hadde þe lyonnys for drawe hem euerychonand
                    þus oure lord euere a mong wrechiþ hym of his foon

BLCottVesBXVI.First Lines:
…Bote kaym his sone made he no nisþo said adam lord lord
                    þis is riȝt…
BLCottVesBXVI.Last Lines:
…The hele of mylis he bad forwepynas his fader him bedeþ
                    he hit scholde bryneThe aungel…
BLCottVesBXVI.Note:
On flyleaves at front, written by a fifteenth-century hand; incomplete
                    at beginning and end.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Þo lady he [......] in parays in one fair placeInto an orchard þat he made þorw his holi grace…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Sone hede þe leons vor swolewed hem echonAnd so oure lord euer among nimeþ wreche of is fon
BLEge1993.Note: 1802 lines. First page illegible due to wear so first lines here from folio 1v.

BLSto949.First Lines: After iacob & is sones in Egypte were dedeMuche folk in þe lond come & wyde sprong of here sede…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …þis & wel more oure lord seide þo gan moyses adoun gon& het is folk þes lauwes holde hii it graunteden echonMoyses wende aft vp aȝen me ne miht for myst him yse
BLSto949.Note: 191 lines (a section covering the Life of Moses). Ends imperfectly.

Lam223.First Lines:
When hit comes in my þoȝt þe mykel sorow &
                    synneÞe sorynesse & þe wrecchidnesse þat sues here
                    monkynne…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Atte last wole þe holy gost in forme of a swerde
                    lyȝtAnd anticrist to deþ smyte þurȝ his swete
                    myȝt
